meanings.definition: A soft, light-colored sedimentary rock composed mainly of the siliceous shells of diatoms.
meanings.sent1: The diatomite found in the quarry is perfect for studying ancient sea life.
meanings.sent2: Miners extracted diatomite from the earth to use in construction.
meanings.sent3: The artist sculpted a tiny diatomite mountain out of the delicate rock.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as fragile as a piece of diatomite, easily broken.
meanings.sent5: The classroom display showcased the beauty of diatomite formations.

meanings.definition: A fine powder made up of the microscopic shells of diatoms, used as an abrasive and filtering material.
meanings.sent1: The diatomite powder was sprinkled on the spill to absorb the liquid quickly.
meanings.sent2: The factory workers wore masks to avoid inhaling the diatomite dust.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved turning water into diatomite powder.
meanings.sent4: The chef used diatomite as a secret ingredient to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent5: The aquarium filter was filled with diatomite to keep the water crystal clear.
